def: A movement in tactics by which the order of companies in lineis inverted, the right being on the left, the left on the right, andso on.
Slacked, or pulverized, by exposure to the air; as, air-slackedlime.
Instructing; improving; as, an edifying conversation.-- Ed"i*fy`ing*ly, adv.-- Ed"i*fy`ing*ness, n.
A military adventurer of the fourteenth and fifteenthcenturies, who sold his services, and those of his followers, to anyparty in any contest.
Concerned in the formation of chyle; as, the chylopoeticorgans.
A larval crustacean in a stage following the nauplius, andhaving about seven pairs of appendages.
A rapid dance in six-eight time in which a large number joinhands and dance in various figures, sometimes moving from room toroom. It originated in Provence.
Spray blown from the tops waves during a gale at sea; also,snow driven in the wind at sea; -- written also spindrift.

The quality or state of being sensitive; -- used chiefly inscience and the arts; as, the sensitivity of iodized silver.Sensitivity and emotivity have also been used as the scientific termfor the capacity of feeling. Hickok.
Devoted to the offices of Venus, or love; venereal. [Obs.] "Iam all venerean in feeling." Chaucer.
A kind of oak-leaf gall. See Gall.
